I've seen some people explain this on YouTube, and I have to agree with these statements.
"Don't play a game to win; play a game to improve."  This is important so even if you do lose the game, make sure you take something out of it to better yourself and make you win more games in the future.
"Never give up."  This follows closely with the next statement,
"Be positive!"  No this doesn't mean your K/D (also as a pet peeve I have, I hate people comparing your skill to your KD.  You could just be having a bad game or the other person happens to out-skill you.  That doesn't necessarily show your skill or experience with the game/champion.)  Be a positive player and keep your teams hopes up.  If you are the person that's saying "GG Team too heavy" or anything related to that, you are lowering your team's morale and making that game feel utterly hopeless.  What you should do is keep your team's spirits high by complementing people whenever you make a good play (even if its a small thing such as warding, and warding especially in lower elo/rank) and also make sure to reassure your team after something bad happens.  Something as simple as "It's ok guys, we can still do this." can help make you and your team more energized and positive, leading to a possible comeback.

As an extra thing to remember, no one is perfect, not even the pro teams.  There is ALWAYS something you could have done better.  If you come across a bad play that you and your team made, don't yell and flame at them.  Instead you could offer a suggestion in a POLITE way such as "Doing x wasn't a bad idea, but maybe next time you could try y and see if it works better.  Just offering a suggestion."  However, an even better thing to do is to just worry about improving yourself (still doesn't mean putting down your team in the process, but focus on improving yourself more than your allies) since after that game, more than likely you won't play with them again.

If there's anything to take away from this ramble (aka here comes the TL;DR)
Be Positive
Don't give up
Always strive to improve (on yourself mostly)

I always come in expecting to win. So I play that way. And I mean really play that way. Not in ways that are counter productive to my stated goal like many people do in many aspects of life. It would be terrible to come into the game with already sabotaged morale IMO. Raging at my team is not increasing my chances of winning the game. AFKing will never improve my chances of winning. Playing recklessly without consideration for the risks that are taken will not increase my chances of winning on a consistent basis.

That all said, I accept that losing is always a possibility. That plans can fall apart, and that people get outplayed or simply have bad games, myself included.

Honestly for me it's less about my own mistakes and more being completely out of control or able to do something when games go south. Example, play shaco jungle, get first blood for my bot lane, get two kills for myself, top feeds like a buffet, mid feeds like a buffet, adc who I gave kills to gets overconfident, joins the fun of feeding. As a jungler I can only do so much, so once I get tiamat, I swap to split pushing, telling them to play defense,  but I'm sure any player with a brain stem knows they won't be doing that.  They continue to do stupid things. I can't help them because enemy nasus can one shot me at this point.  Get reported for afk farming by the 4 people who can't play defense.

If I make mistakes,  I typically will not blame others, it serves no point. It's usually a quiet 'god I suck' etc. To myself.

I usually buy a tiamat, deep ward enemy jungle and farm my jungle until I get their junglers location. Then I gank the lane that has a chance to succeed and is far away enough from their jungler so they don't counter me (which would lose the game).
Works most of the time so I can at least keep the team in the game.
Out of the 5 ranked games with shaco the loss was one of those unwinnable games. I did everything I could but even killing 3 of their players solo in the last fight wasn't enough to win. I killed a 6 item ap jungle nidalee a 5 item graves and a support lulu alone under the bot inhib tower as Shaco while my team lost 2v4 under mid inhib tower to malphite top and dunno what they had mid.

That was a depressing game. I had more damage done to enemy champs than all the other players in the team combined and the only positive score at 10 5 11 or something like that... /:
And I fed my team at least 10 kills during the early mid game. They were just that bad that for example I gank bot we get 1 kill on me 1 on adc and the enemy both use all their sums. 1 min later they return to lane and 2v2 kill our adc + support with at least 1 sum up each. They also had more gold....
I split pushed and even got an inhib while we only lost 1 inner tower at one time but it was all in vain. I deleted at least the adc + another squishy every fight and we still lost them. Culminating in the 3v1 and 2v4 dive described before which lost the game.

Im not confident enough in my shaco to play him in ranked. I've been playing him forever (3rd champ I ever bought) but I will admit I'm not very good at him. He's by far the most unique jungler as no one has a play style like his. That said.. I occasionally have good games with him, I typically feel that not enough people know how to play 'with' a shaco, as they expect him to be in the middle of team fights or stuff like other assassins. If he became a monster late there would be no issue but he falls off so hard.

His lategame is really good. Unless they have 2+ pink ward trinkets and the support is packing pinks... Happened last game, we had a really bad teamcomp (teambuilder) ... rengar shaco vayne. They pushed a lane and just pinked the lane there was no way to get to anyone. They always had 5 pinks on the map + trinkets up/pinks in inventory... That was extremely annoying to play against.

I go for blue machette upgrade -> tiamat -> IE so I can 3 shot squishies at around 25-30mins in and play more of a teamfight oriented style. People don't expect it that much because most shaco's I see split 24/7. And it's really effective all you have to do is have upgraded sweeper + raptor buff is great to know you're not spotted and delete a carry that's slightly mispositioned. Can't lose a 5v4 even as shaco.

Or I bait out important CC/ult by jumping on the person carrying it and time my ult so I completely dodge it and then the team just cleans house and I either live or die but take at least 1 with me.

From my experience he only is great late game if he is ahead. There are assassins that get insane late game. but I've never found shaco to be all that great late. If I want to go for a late game assassin I stick with rengar. Shaco is fun in his own way however. I'm just under-confident in my skills with him.
Their damage gets more insane but nobody has the utility shaco has. His kit is just so deep, there's so many things that can be done that it really has no cap.
